lines.gurmukhi: sill mY Drin Drin mY sill jYsy kUp AnrUp kY ibml jl Cwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Salil Mai Dharani Dharani Mai Salil Jaisay , Koop Anaroop Kai Bimal Jal Chhaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As there is land in water and water inside Earth, like a well that is dug up to obtain neat and cold water;

lines.gurmukhi: qwhI jl mwtI kY bnweI Gitkw Anyk eykY jlu Gt Gt Gitkw smwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Taahee Jal Maatee Kai Banaaee Ghatikaa Anayka , Aykai Jalu Ghat Ghat Ghatikaa Samaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The same water and earth are used for making pots and pitchers and all of them contain the same type of water.

lines.gurmukhi: jwhI jwhI Gitkw mY diRstI kY dyKIAq pyKIAq Awpw Awpu Awn n idKwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaahee Jaahee Ghatikaa Mai Drisatee Kai Daykheeata , Paykheeat Aapaa Aapu Aan N Dikhaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Whichever pot or pitcher one looks into, one would see the same image in it, and nothing else is seen,

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm gur eykMkwr ky Akwr bHm ibbyk eyk tyk Thrwey hY ]110]
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Gur Aykankaar Kay Akaara , Braham Bibayk Ayk Tayk Tthaharaaay Hai ?110?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the complete God pervades in the form of a-Guru and appear in the hearts of Sikhs (as was the case of image in various water-filled pots and pitchers). (110)
